#summary Reference to all the properties used in appstart.properties

= Appstart properties =

|| *Property* || *Description* || *Default value* ||
|| app.main.class || a fully-qualified class. *Required* || null ||
|| app.libs.dir || the directory where appstart can find the dependent jars || "" ||
|| app.vm.options || a list of VM options || "" ||
|| app.class.path || additional class paths || "" ||
|| app.follow || set to true to follow the application output to console. Useful for debugging purposes || false ||

== System properties ==

Each entry in the appstart.properties file is included as a system property in the started application, so you can specify other entries such as:
 * *java.util.logging.config.file* to configure the logging configuration, 
 * *http.proxyHost* to configure the HTTP proxy.
 * *java.rmi.codebase* to configure the RMI codebase URL.
